thread.title: Lowry scores 40 points to lift Raptors to 112-107 win
thread.title_full: Lowry scores 40 points to lift Raptors to 112-107 win

title: Lowry scores 40 points to lift Raptors to 112-107 win
text:
Lowry scores 40 points to lift Raptors to 112-107 win By   
TORONTO (AP) - Kyle Lowry scored 40 points to help the Toronto Raptors beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 112-107 on Monday night. 
Lowry, who broke the franchise record for points in a preseason game set by Vince Carter (38), hit six 3-pointers and was 13 for 18 from the field. Cory Joseph added 14 points, Jonas Valanciunas had 13 points and Luis Scola 12. 
Andrew Wiggins, the reigning NBA rookie of the year led the Wolves (0-3) with 21 points in 18 minutes. His older brother Nick, who was signed by Minnesota last month, scored six points in the final five minutes. 
The Raptors and Wolves meet again in Ottawa on Wednesday as part of the NBA’s Canada Series, which featured soldout games in Winnipeg and Vancouver, and then Ottawa and Montreal. The Raptors play the Washington Wizards in Montreal to cap the series on Oct. 23.
